main event: An oval object brighter and larger than 12 miles was observed on radar in the Sub-Hawaiian Islands.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on 31 March 1950 and lasted for 10 seconds., The object was greater than 12 miles in size., The sighting was categorized as a ground-radar observation., Several reports of unidentified flying objects have been documented in the Hawaiian Islands area during the 1960s., One sighting noted an unusually large aerial object that maneuvered at high speeds.
witness description: No specific witnesses listed for this sighting.
